newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lankan rupee ends firmer after early fall.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lankan rupee ends firmer after early fall.

text.p: The Sri Lankan rupee closed shade firmer at 55.80 to the dollar on Wednesday after recovering from early weakness caused by import covering, dealers said.
The rupee opened at its previous close of 55.82 to the dollar, and fell on import covering by two banks which was carried over from Tuesday, they said.
"The dollar hit a high of 55.91," a foreign bank dealer said. But profit-taking and the end of import-covering by one state bank pushed the dollar lower, he added.
A fresh U.S. attack against Iraq did not have any major impact on the local currency, dealers said.
The overnight call money rate closed at its opening level of 16 percent, dealers said.
It compared with 14.25 percent on Tuesday but dealers said the call money rate did not have any impact on the rupee's movement.
